result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Brian Musgrave was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
Defendant shall priovide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Restitution payable to Curt W. $8,000.00 and Eric G. $1,500.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept. Bail to be applied, if applicable. Payable first during probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Brian Musgrave

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Brian Musgrave not in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to sentencing. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 24 MONTHS; CONSECUTIVE; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Earned Released Program.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 4 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Restitution payable to Curt W. $8,000.00 and Eric G. $1,500.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Daniel Brian Musgrave in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Defendant Daniel Brian Musgrave in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 6.

Court order $1,000.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.

Defendant Daniel Brian Musgrave in court with attorney William Redding.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading.  Review hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 09:30 am.
